meanings.definition: A decrease in the price of a security or commodity.
meanings.sent1: The downticks in the stock market worried investors.
meanings.sent2: The downticks in oil prices led to lower profits for the company.
meanings.sent3: The downticks in banana prices made the monkeys happy.
meanings.sent4: The downticks in the housing market signaled a rough time ahead.
meanings.sent5: The downticks in sales painted a bleak picture for the business.

meanings.definition: To decrease in value or price.
meanings.sent1: The company downticks its products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: If the demand decreases, the company downticks the prices.
meanings.sent3: She downticks the volume on the radio when her favorite song comes on.
meanings.sent4: The sun downticks its brightness as evening approaches.
meanings.sent5: He downticks his offer to negotiate a better deal.
